alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Suffolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 19 at 4:35AM EST until January 20 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 11 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways (10.9 to 12.7 feet Mean Lower Low Water). * WHERE...Eastern Essex MA, Suffolk MA, Eastern Norfolk MA and Eastern Plymouth MA Counties. * WHEN...From 5 AM to 11 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor coastal flooding occurs along Morrissey Boulevard in Boston. Coastal flooding is expected along the North Shore from Gloucester to Newburyport. Wave action will likely cause some washover onto coastal roads around the time of high tide. && Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Gloucester Harbor MLLW Categories - Minor 11.5 ft, Moderate 13.0 ft, Major 15.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.5 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 19/08 AM 10.7/11.2 1.2/ 1.7 0.6/ 1.1 2-3 None 19/09 PM 9.2/ 9.7 -0.3/ 0.2 0.6/ 1.1 2 None 20/09 AM 11.9/12.4 2.3/ 2.8 1.3/ 1.8 5-6 Minor 20/10 PM 10.3/10.8 0.8/ 1.3 1.3/ 1.8 6-7 None 21/10 AM 12.0/12.5 2.5/ 3.0 1.0/ 1.5 4-5 Minor 21/11 PM 9.9/10.4 0.4/ 0.9 0.6/ 1.1 3 None Merrimack River near Newburyport MA MLLW Categories - info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
